    • Method Detail

      • getMatchingDocuments

        public java.util.Collection<ChronoIndexDocument> getMatchingDocuments(long timestamp,
                                                                      Branch branch,
                                                                      java.lang.String keyspace,
                                                                      SearchSpecification<?> searchSpec)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentBasedIndexManagerBackend
        Returns the set of ChronoIndexDocuments that match the given search specification at the given timestamp, in the given branch.

        This method also searches through the origin branches (recursively). It returns only the most recent documents (up to and including the given timestamp).

        Specified by:
        getMatchingDocuments in interface DocumentBasedIndexManagerBackend
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp up to which the documents should be searched. Must not be negative.
        branch - The branch in which to start the search. Origin branches will be searched as well (recursively). Must not be null.
        keyspace - The keyspace to search in. Must not be null.
        searchSpec - The search specification to fulfill. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The set of documents that match the given search criteria. May be empty, but never null.

      • rollback

        public void rollback(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> branches,
                     long timestamp)
        Description copied from interface: IndexManagerBackend
        Performs a rollback to the given timestamp of all the indices in the given branches.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface IndexManagerBackend
        Parameters:
        branches - The names of the branches on which to perform the index rollback. Must not be null.
        timestamp - The timestamp to roll back to. Must not be negative.

      • rollback

        public void rollback(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> branches,
                     long timestamp,
                     java.util.Set<QualifiedKey> keys)
        Description copied from interface: IndexManagerBackend
        Performs a rollback to the given timestamp of all the indices in the given branches, restricted to the documents with the given keys.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface IndexManagerBackend
        Parameters:
        branches - The names of the branches on which to perform the index rollback. Must not be null.
        timestamp - The timestamp to roll back to. Must not be negative.
        keys - The keys to roll back. Must not be null.

      • rollbackInternal

        protected void rollbackInternal(long timestamp,
                                java.util.Set<java.lang.String> branches,
                                java.util.Set<QualifiedKey> keys)
        Performs the actual rollback operation on this index.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp to roll back to. Must not be negative.
        keys - The set of keys to roll back. If the set is null, all keys will be rolled back. If the set is empty, no keys will be rolled back. If the set is non-empty, only the given keys will be rolled back.

      • isDocumentRelevantForRollback

        protected boolean isDocumentRelevantForRollback(ChronoIndexDocument document,
                                                java.util.Set<QualifiedKey> keys)
        A helper method to determine if the given document is relevant for rollback with respect to the set of keys to roll back.
        Parameters:
        document - The document to check. Must not be null.
        keys - The set of keys to roll back. May be null to indicate that all keys will be rolled back.
        Returns:
        If the given set is null, this method will always return true. If the set is empty, this method will always return false. Otherwise, this method returns true if and only if the document is bound to a qualified key that is in this set.

      • getDocumentsTouchedAtOrAfterTimestamp

        protected abstract java.util.Set<ChronoIndexDocument> getDocumentsTouchedAtOrAfterTimestamp(long timestamp,
                                                                                            java.util.Set<java.lang.String> branches)
        Returns the set of documents that were added and/or modified exactly at the given timestamp, or after the given timestamp.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp in question. Must not be negative.
        branches - The set of branches to retrieve the documents for. If null, documents from all branches will be retrieved. If this set is empty, then the result set will also be empty.
        Returns:
        The set of index documents that were added and/or modified exactly at or after the given timestamp. May be empty, but never null.

      • getTerminatedBranchLocalDocuments

        protected abstract java.util.Collection<ChronoIndexDocument> getTerminatedBranchLocalDocuments(long timestamp,
                                                                                               java.lang.String branchName,
                                                                                               java.lang.String keyspace,
                                                                                               SearchSpecification<?> searchSpec)

                                                                                             SearchSpecification<?> searchSpec)
